Text saved: Faith47 is an artist from Cape Town, South Africa. She paints big, colourful pictures of people and animals, and she likes to paint in many different places. For example, you can see her art on pavements, in factories that are not used, and on old cars. She likes that most street art is temporary, which means it will soon disappear because the weather or cleaners from the city will remove it. For Faith47, this shows how life is always changing, with things ending and new things starting.

While clear, this simplification uses very basic vocabulary and breaks down a more abstract concept into overly simple terms for B1. To achieve a B1 classification, the text should aim for a slightly more sophisticated vocabulary and sentence structure, perhaps by retaining some B1-level synonyms or using B1 connectors more deliberately, while still ensuring clarity. For instance, 'disused factories' or 'unused factories' would be more appropriate for B1 than 'factories that are not used'.
